alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 6:30PM CDT until September 21 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT/7 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nebraska, including the following county, Cherry. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT /700 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM CDT /528 PM MDT/, Earlier reports from local Emergency Management indicated some road flooding in Cherry county, and runoff from earlier heavy rainfall will likely continue to produce minor flooding in the advisory area for the next 1 to 2 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Valentine and Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
